website_summaries.verdict: In spite of a few consumer concerns, many more buyers love all that this square has to offer considering its budget-friendly price.
pros: A popular choice thanks to its low price and user-friendly features, including the durable acrylic level vial and die cast zinc head
A practical option that fits most users' needs
cons: Some consumers received tools that were several degrees off from square
The blade is a bit flimsy, and the slide lock has been known to stick

customer_reviews.title: These can be adjusted to be perfectly square in 2 minutes
customer_reviews.text: So many 1 stars are saying these are not square. They don't realize that this style is the only type of square that can be easily adjusted in 2 minutes, and dialed in exactly squate by filing one of two alignment guides inside the slide area. Just check YouTube. Super easy and exact as long as you have a thin file. All squares should be checked over time for weather changes and after being dropped. This style is good for a lifetime. The 6" is SUCH a useful size for marking and woodworking. Great value for $8. Easily worth double or more.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Sr

customer_reviews.title: Not square
customer_reviews.text: Was not square, exchanged to try again. Got second one, not square either!!!
customer_reviews.author: Water Sparx

customer_reviews.title: terrible glare, wobbles, finish coming off
customer_reviews.text: I'm constantly having to try to look at the ruler from a different angle to get away from the glare of my overhead lighting; many times I simply cannot see the measurement. Making the ruler non-glare seems like a no-brainer for anyone who makes such a tool. As other reviewers have noted, the ruler wobbles when I fix it at either end no matter how tight I make it. So I'm not sure if it's really square. And at one end, that shiny finish is just turning black - guess I must be crazy to expect a $10 tool to last more than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: WTL

customer_reviews.title: Not square
customer_reviews.text: Item isn't square. Didn't work out. Had to order an engineer square instead.
customer_reviews.author: I. J. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Man I wish I could afford another Starrett. I bought this for my tool belt. My Starrett sits in my machining cabinet with my other precision tools. Still; we're comparing this to a $100 tool. The quality is similar considering the materials. Fit and finish are better than you should expect at this price point. I've used Swanson squares for many, many years and often grab them for precision layout. If hey weren't so danged durable I might buy a few more of them. Expect this to be the last square you buy.
customer_reviews.author: theuser

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this square. It works well for wood working. It is great for making multiple identical marks, or lining items up to be the same at multiple points. I even used it to align my new table saw front rail, which had to be 3/16" below the beveled edge. Just hang over the side. Line up the ruler. Lock it down, and check across the rail easily on both ends and along the center. The adjustable nature of the ruler makes it very useful.
customer_reviews.author: LinckG

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed if I secure have the body toward the end of the blade it gets wobbly and can give wrong reading for right angles. Also, if you want to be able to use it over a whole 12 inches, you are better off getting the 16 inch version of this. Because of where you have to secure the body for it not to wobble, you only get about 9 of the 12 inches from the 12 inch model.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Got what I paid for/serves me right
customer_reviews.text: Unlucky for me this is a prime example of junk; highly doubt it would make even a decent paper weight. The knurled knob does not lock and even when tight allows slippage of the rule, which is very difficult to read because of poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: dodgers

customer_reviews.title: Had parts missing :_(
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these. Overall impressed, the head is nice and solid (not flimsy at all) with machined surfaces. Unfortunately one of them arrived without the scribe tool installed. Not worth sending back, but at the same time, rather disappointing to be missing a piece. (If the seller is reading this, I don't know whether this is a Q/A issue, or whether the part was lost in shipping -- if so, perhaps sealing the item in a plastic bag would help.)
customer_reviews.author: L. Eilander

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what the mediocre reviews are about. My square is dead on square, flat, and straight. This and a pencil are the only tools that are present at all times in my shop apron pocket. The size is perfect for most jobs I encounter, and the construction leaves nothing to be desired. If you have an electron microscope, maybe you could detect some slight out-of-square or dimensional deviation. My machine tools can't find any slop.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Good and cheap.
customer_reviews.text: For the level of precision i need out of a combo square and how much i abuse them doing door hardware these are great. The locking pins always wear out first. I set a length on it 40-50 times per shift and it is fine. They last about 1.5 months then are done. Yes they get recycled. And no i dont try and fix them. Someone please make a 7" combo square like the old Craftsman ones.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K.

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: Checked with machinist square and surprisingly this square does not deliver 90 degree but may be 89. Both ends of ruler are roughly cut and even straitened. Even low priced, products should be deliver most basic functionalities. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: KS2000

customer_reviews.title: Mine is defective
customer_reviews.text: The one I received must have slipped through quality control. When placing it flat to measure 90 degrees, it rocks a little.
customer_reviews.author: RMB

customer_reviews.title: Not a Precision Tool
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a step up from the basic square I have owned for years and I wanted something more advanced and flexible. But the groove in which the part slides is too wide and it requires another fixed square every time you slide it to make it square again. I had hoped it did not need that.
customer_reviews.author: Farzad

customer_reviews.title: Swanson
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but good things to say about Swanson. Most of my measuring tools are by them, for good reason. They have made an excellent name for themselves, and are a USA based company. This combination square is no exception. If you are in the market for a well made, affordable, square then this is it. Swanson does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lee Brummett

customer_reviews.title: Good for tablesaw alignment
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how accurate it is. I have mostly used it for aligning my Kobalt tablesaw. Sometimes it moves slightly while tightening the screw, but if done carefully it isn't that bad. Helped me to align my table saw for a low price. Aligned the blade and fence with this and my cuts are pretty accurate so far.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Not Square, but can be fixed without additional tools
customer_reviews.text: The Swanson 6 inch square is not square out of the box. You will need to manually square it. You can do it without additional tools. Use the edges of the ruler to file down one of the two lead sections inside the base depending on which way the ruler tilts. File slowly and check often to make sure you don’t file down one of the leads too much and end up filing down the other lead. You can also YouTube the process if you need a visual tutorial.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: Simple, well-built, useful tool, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple combo square, but it's well-built and is incredibly useful for building pretty much anything that requires precise right angle measurements. I use it for building home audio systems, specifically speaker enclosures. I have another 8" fixed square from Swanson and I liked it so much I decided to get one that was more versatile. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What you expect
customer_reviews.text: Stays out on the bench. Dead square and ready to go. Read the literature that come with it. Found a couple of uses I never thought of. Been woodworking 25+ years & have developed habits based on getting results - I now have new habits that include using this square. Old dogs can learn new tricks.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hook

customer_reviews.title: ... not in fact square - it's off by a good 5 degrees
customer_reviews.text: The square is not in fact square - it's off by a good 5 degrees. It feels sturdy, but doesn't do what it's supposed to to at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J.

customer_reviews.title: You'll need another square to keep this one square
customer_reviews.text: After adjustment, this is a useful tool. But first, you need to already own a square so that you can bring this adjustable one into alignment. It's a bit of a Catch-22.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: GOOD quality.. Not great.. BUT EXCELLENT price vs. quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have some expensive Starrett squares. This keeps them (my Starrett's) a bit less used, on rougher work. EXCELLENT quality vs. cost in this product.. I strongly recommend the Swanson combo square.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stainless
customer_reviews.text: I like that the rule is stainless (no rust), and in contrast with my 15yr resident square, has an easily legible scale and numerals (resident square, poor legibility from the start). On delivery, the new square had no scriber in the square or any trace in the clean packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Missing a Piece
customer_reviews.text: I used to own this little 6 inch combo square and loved it. I just ordered another, because my first was misplaced. I am happy with the quality of ALL of my Swanson tools, however this little combo square is missing the tiny little screw in scribe. I'm going to reach out and see if I can get a replacement sent out to me. Other than that, great product as always! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Handy compact square
customer_reviews.text: Despite warnings of poor accuracy I have found this to line up squarely if you take the half second to align it properly before tightening. I like it for being compact yet crisp of line.
customer_reviews.author: loonery,  Boston, MA

customer_reviews.title: Metric scale included
customer_reviews.text: Poor description and pictures. You would think with a tool this simple they couldn't go wrong. What they don't tell you is that one of the 4 scales is metric. Generally not a problem, but sometimes you just can't turn the tool around to avoid it.
customer_reviews.author: 456dust

customer_reviews.title: Good square for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these in my wood shop in varying sizes. For the price, they are outstanding. Instead of breaking the bank on one of the high end ones, I can spend less and always have the square I need at hand at any of my benches.
customer_reviews.author: CP111

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: Works great and the ruler comes off if you just need a small ruler for another job. There is also a package that includes a Speed Square that I wish I had seen first. But I’m happy with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I started as a a machinist in a time that if you didn’t use Starrett or Brown & Sharpe you were considered a carpenter. This may not be a Starrett but it has a feel and smoothness that outweighs its price.
customer_reviews.author: FR

customer_reviews.title: Country of Origin not disclosed
customer_reviews.text: Did not like the fact that they mention their company was in business 90 years but the product came from China. Nowhere does it mention where this product was made.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: best bet
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this and haven't been able to stop using it since then. Easy to both read and adjust this is an excellent choose for beginners and advanced alike. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: johnny swatek

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these (1 in 12” and 1 in 16”) and the 16” was missing the attached level head (see pictures for more information).
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Nice small size for my projects
customer_reviews.text: I was happy enough with the quality. As many report, the tool doesn't slide well, but I think will loosen up with time. Build quality seems good.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rand

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality, awful machining.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it was machined in a cave with stone tooling, what a joke!!! I could have made a better tool myself. Every bullnose edge is a mess. Picture tells it all.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Troyus

customer_reviews.title: Well made  --  Good Value
customer_reviews.text: After reading the negative reviews regarding this tool not being square out of the box, I was pleased to see my new square was perfect. The casting is beefy, the numbers are easy to read, plus it offers centimeters on one scale. I use my tools and they do get dropped so I was reluctant to spring for a high dollar square that would likely sit in the drawer. I am quite pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bobo

customer_reviews.title: Sawnson - Not Just a TV Dinner...
customer_reviews.text: Tightens nicely - holds it position. No need to tighten with pliers like my HF's. Checks square with flip over line drawing. Probably will buy a couple more as I set each one for repetitive measurement for consistent layouts.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: good 6" combination square
customer_reviews.text: for the money a good value. The rule is quite good. The Zink body looks good but may not hold up to wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: HiCmpr

customer_reviews.title: A very handy tool for layout of woodworking projects.
customer_reviews.text: Everything I need in a square this size. I don’t do the type of work that requires extreme exacting tolerances.
customer_reviews.author: alfisch

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Item was received and well packaged, however, the level part was totally missing so I have a metal ruler and that's it. :(
customer_reviews.author: S Foster

customer_reviews.title: Works in small places.
customer_reviews.text: This square is well made and accurate. Very handy in tight places where you can't use a 12 inch square. Easy ti keep in pocket if necessary. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McMilleon

customer_reviews.title: Good as a spare.
customer_reviews.text: OK -- got what I paid for. Works, but very disappointed in milling surface. It's not smooth at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size. I use this a lot. I do not understand all the negative reviews. Its a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price, can’t afford a 100 dollar pro model and it’s accurate so I’m good with it.
customer_reviews.author: Plrh8r

customer_reviews.title: Basically great. And for the price
customer_reviews.text: Basically great. And for the price, it can't be beat! That said, know for a fact that the one I received is not 100% square. It's close (like closer than will ever practically be needed for most projects), but I wouldn't use it for machine work. Oh, and the on-board scribe is a really nice thing to have!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: High quality and useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool to have in your tool box or even pocket. Very handy and useful size.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: In my humid shop, it won't rust, very nice craftsmanship; well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: PJDSR

customer_reviews.title: Fine tool that gets a lot of use
customer_reviews.text: Fine tool that gets a lot of use. This and the 16 inch combo are essential parts of my woodworking tool set
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Norris Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice 6 inch square
customer_reviews.text: Nice combo square. The only thing I can nitpick is the little scratch all at the bottom can only be taken out with a pair of pliers , because the threads are messed up
customer_reviews.author: Lenin C

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item and it came without the scribe. I sent it back (did not have to take care of the packaging to return it) and received a new one. The second one is again missing the scribe. So now I have to return this one but now I am required to pay for the packaging to return it. This is ridiculous. Absolutely do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Halley Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice product this far but mine did not come with the scribe. It was simply missing.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Haug

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would of bought one 40 years ago! For Woodworking,really handy for many types of applications!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C.

customer_reviews.title: Square 1
customer_reviews.text: Had one before. The size fits in most places works great. A strong tool.
customer_reviews.author: B and B

customer_reviews.title: Works good. No issues so far
customer_reviews.text: I use them both quite a bit in the shop. Haven't had any issues with them. Much better than the last set I got.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: It's just what it looks like. Simple but decent tool. I find I use it a lot so it's almost always on my tool belt.
customer_reviews.author: JeffLearman

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but one does notice the the rule is a cut off 12" rather than a purpose made 6" rule. No matter, it's easy to read and is exactly 6" or within a micron or two
customer_reviews.author: barondeke

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built, pretty and good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice piece of equipment. I'm not sure if it is a pro or con, but the corner edges of everything are very "sharp".
customer_reviews.author: Larry in FL

customer_reviews.title: All the square you’ll ever need
customer_reviews.text: Excellent square, well made and very solid. As accurate as anyone would ever need for wood working, plus it’s made in America. There’s no reason to spend more money this is all the square you’ll ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Stringray

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: It works but it also feels flimsy the marking metal (pencil thingy) is hard to get out sorry i forgot the name and you loss like half an inch or so because how it grabs the ruller
customer_reviews.author: Husky Phil

customer_reviews.title: Top notch product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I got one with the scribe missing, customer service at Swanson was totally cool told me they would send it directly to me, I appreciate it. I bought 3 squares for my workshop. They are sturdy and can be squared up when needed after dropping it or as the tool wears over time.
customer_reviews.author: Ian D

customer_reviews.title: Nice combination square
customer_reviews.text: Nice markings, works well. We use it constantly making bird feeders. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ranchdog

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this square and the quality seemed OK but it didn't come with the scribe, Amazon replaced it but the second one had no scribe as well. Looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B.

customer_reviews.title: The small size is perfect for the electronic assemblies I’m making.
customer_reviews.text: Used for marking cutouts and holes in small, electronic enclosures.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Slips and isn't square. There are better deals for better squares on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ret

customer_reviews.title: NOT SQUARE. Incredibly sharp however!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a kitchen knife, look no further. Every single edge on this instrument is razor sharp and ready to slice, dice and chiffonade your hands! Which is a good thing because it's completely useless for its designed purpose as a combination square.
customer_reviews.author: BORK BORK BORK!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing square,love it
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile and high quality square. Amazing product and glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: NCAmazonCust

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool. If you want to do things right, you should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Morelli

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very handy.. fits in shop apron pocket......adjustable .....use it a lot in the shop....
customer_reviews.author: SCSJR6

customer_reviews.title: Solid and square
customer_reviews.text: This small square is exactly what I was looking for. Small enough to fit in my tool apron but large enough to be an effective square for woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bess

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: A good quality products. Well made but a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great!!
customer_reviews.text: used this to aid in cutting the supports for my metal carport....works great!!
customer_reviews.author: 53burb

customer_reviews.title: Can't do better for this price!
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular value on this combination square. It seems like really nice quality to me. All metal construction, smooth sliding, locks securely in place. I seriously doubt that you will be disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan - Avid Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Easily readable engravings, really like that it ha metric and standard markings.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money spent.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for measuring the distance from blade to fence on my table saw. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Braswell

customer_reviews.title: It literally fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for me for about 6 months then it fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Rick D

customer_reviews.title: The gold standard.
customer_reviews.text: Grew up in my dad's shop with these Swanson tools. I'm all grown up now. Sigh.... So now I've got my own.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse S.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money.
customer_reviews.text: No problem with product. Pretty true right out of the packaging. Outside edges of body are eased in manufacturing; inside edges are quite sharp. Product is manufactured in China.
customer_reviews.author: Razz

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Quality is good so far. I was expecting something to break early like the locking mechanism or the level cracking. Neither has happened thus far. However, I hardly use it, so I don't know how well it would perform under heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: searching for Swanson
customer_reviews.text: I just realized that Lowes distributes Swanson products now. I couldn't find it at local lumber yards so I tried Home Depot and then went to amazon. The price is pretty close too. I go with Swanson over Johnson or Empire because its the brand I recognize that all the older guys had when I first started.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I really like this. Very precise and can completely remove the ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. Very precise and can completely remove the square/level piece so you just have a metal measuring device. Very flexible, feels well built. I've avoided using it for "rough" projects so I'm not sure how it stands up to abuse, but for finishing work it's very nice.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pickett

customer_reviews.title: good solid tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: sturdy,seems quality made at a very good price. Great for the DIY ers
customer_reviews.author: john borzumato

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little square. Very handy and good quality and price. I've bought two and was not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: WinDee

customer_reviews.title: works great however it is a bit crusty on the slide
customer_reviews.text: works great however it is a bit crusty on the slide, either not well ground or there is left over grinding residue
customer_reviews.author: ethan

customer_reviews.title: Very great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an accurate scale and feels really durable and high end. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marly

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this mechanics' square by swanson. So many times, I'm afraid to purchase tools before I put them in my hand, because at low prices, they are likely poorly made. This square is a solid tool and very heavy for the size. I was impressed. Also, the locking mechanism stays locked. If you're looking for a low priced, high quality mechanics' square. This is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: RWB

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t receive correct product
customer_reviews.text: This is what I received? Where’s my scribe? Or the combination square? If I wanted a ruler I would have bought a ruler...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great easy to dislocate the ruler from it and easy to slide it back in. Very accurate
customer_reviews.author: The Chemist

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted and it's rugged and does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic accuracy for the money
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic accuracy for the money. I tested it against my engineer square and it was as accurate as it could be.
customer_reviews.author: Woodshark

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommemd.
customer_reviews.text: It does it’s job. Good quality and very affordable. Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Nice square, but.
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars had it been made in USA. Overall nice square.
customer_reviews.author: j4300

customer_reviews.title: but it's small and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: The rule isn't the same length on one face as it is the other, but it's small and easy to handle, and still proved very useful. Good quality, just adjust for the difference if you're going to be flipping it.
customer_reviews.author: Delta

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool but the first came without the scribe tool. Sent a second it is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Fall Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent combo square
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day at work, so I go through them on a regular basis. The brick and mortar store I used to buy them at no longer sells them. There are others, but they are made very cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: RamDogTango

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: So, just got this in today but...no scribe. I'm guessing that it was an error at the warehouse but still that is one selling feature I am not able to utilize.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, better if all the parts came with it.
customer_reviews.text: Parts were missing in A tool that only has a few parts. The scribe did not come with it. Pretty sure there’s someone returned it without the scribe.
customer_reviews.author: Matt VonGunten

customer_reviews.title: Only gripe is I wish I had gotten the next ...
customer_reviews.text: Only gripe is I wish I had gotten the next size bigger, but this one works perfectly for smaller projects.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool. "Square"
customer_reviews.text: Solidly-built and indeed "square" as the prior reviewer stated. I snugged it up to a high quality Carpenter's Square and verified this. This tool helps you draw accurate straight or 45° cut lines on the material you're working with. I discovered that the little plastic one of these that I had been using for years comes close but is NOT truly square.
customer_reviews.author: eyez wide open

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool. I use it a lot
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool. I use it a lot. My old ones got rusty as i live in a wet area. So i expect the stainless steel to be a big improvement.
customer_reviews.author: W. P. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and heavy duty. Can take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Jake M

customer_reviews.title: Robust Tool
customer_reviews.text: As always, I should have bought this a long time ago instead of dealing with cheaper brands. Very robust and solid tool for the homeowner and professional. Perfect for quick and repeatable dimensional lumber layouts
customer_reviews.author: Dave

product_meta.title: Swanson Tool TC132 12-Inch Combo Square (Cast Zinc Body, Stainless Steel Ruler and Brass Bolt)
product_meta.description:
Size:12" (inches)Swanson Tool TC132 12-Inch Combo Square (Cast Zinc Body, Stainless Steel Blade and Brass Bolt), Brass bolt spring-loaded blade assures firm, accurate settings

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
12" Combination Square
feature_bullets: 12 in. stainless steel blade features precision-etched black gradations, includes brass hardware
Multi-tool: Square, depth gauge, height gauge, plumb level, scriber, and level
